## Biography

Carlos Simms is a Mexican-American, first-generation alumnus from The University of Idaho. He was a Ronald E. McNair Achievement Scholar and graduated in December of 2019. His academic accreditation from the institution included a Bachelor of Science in Environmental Social Science and an Academic Certificate in Climate Change. Carlos is now pursuing a Master of Science in Environmental Science and Management at The University of California Santa Barbara, specializing his studies in energy and climate. Carlos aspires to one day work for the public sector in energy and climate work, notably paving the way for a future that considers renewable energy, climate responsibility, and Global South equity.
